Archaeopteryx

Archaeopteryx

The Bird-like Dinosaur

Artist rendering of what paleontologists think Archaeopteryx looked like.

Description

  • A carnivore with a full set of teeth and long tail
  • Adult weight ranges from 1.8 â€“ 2.2 lbs
  • Length from head to tail was approximately 1.7 ft.
  • Maximum running speed: 4.5 mph (estimated)

History

  • Lived during the late Jurassic (150.8 million years ago - 125.45 million years ago)
  • First discovered in Germany during the early 1860s
  • Today fossil specimens can be viewed in London and Germany

Find more details by visiting the Archaeopteryx Wikipedia page.
